intro: Punica granatum var. parvifolia, commonly known as the dwarf pomegranate, is a compact cultivar of the pomegranate plant. It is characterized by its smaller, lance-shaped leaves and reduced floral size compared to the standard pomegranate. This variety thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for container gardening. It produces edible, ruby-red fruits that are similar in flavor to those of the common pomegranate. The plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often used in landscaping due to its hardy nature and low maintenance requirements.
